ygData.subject: RE: Post Patch Procing
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Ah, wait until you get Safe Fall, then you ll be jumping off of those bridges, who needs an elevator to get down? :-) But thanks for bringing up a few
ygData.messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
> Sent: Friday, January 21, 2000 9:46 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Post Patch Procing
>
>
> From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>
>
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:jht@...]
> >Sent: Friday, January 21, 2000 8:50 AM
>
> >> Casting times have been implemented on several activatable items.
> >> This was done to correct issues that could arise from people
> >> chain-casting these items.
>
> >Speaking of which, is it unreasonable to set our default
> travelling pace to
> >"Run" so that we don't have to turn this on whenever we log
> in. Does anyone
> >"walk" in this game? ("sneakers" don't count) This is one of
> the ways I
> >"spot a newbie" is the fact that they're walking around in the newbie
> >killing zones, casually sauntering around trying to catch up
> to things to
> >kill.
>
> I walk in Blackburrow -- where you go up and down that ladder.
> And sometimes in Kelethin too. If its been a while since I've been
> there.

Ah, wait until you get Safe Fall, then you'll be jumping off of those
bridges, who needs an elevator to get down? :-)

But thanks for bringing up a few situations where walk might be useful. I'm
aways falling off of those ladders while trying to get out of the water in
places like Guk or Crushbone. Maybe walk will make it easier to climb out of
these things.

---Windleaf
